data.title: Benjamin Franklin: Wisdom from a Founding Father
data.meta_description: Did you ever ask yourself if someone can truly rise from humble beginnings to great heights? Well, Benjamin Franklin did just that
data.text:
Did you ever ask yourself if someone can truly rise from humble beginnings to great heights? Well, Benjamin Franklin did just that. He started as the son of a soap maker, without much formal education, and yet he became one of America’s Founding Fathers, leaving a mark on history.

Benjamin Franklin was a Polymath — a businessman, diplomat, inventor, scientist, author, philosopher, abolitionist, and statesman.

The question is what can we learn from a man like him? In this article, we will combine his wisdom with small anecdotes from his life.

The article is structured in five parts, which are roughly chronologically according to his life. Still, every Chapter can be taken by itself, so skip freely to what interests you the most. When you want the full Benjamin Franklin experience feel free to read it all.

I Principles, Virtue, and Self-Improvement

His whole life, especially in his early life, Benjamin Franklin was focused on improving himself, his character, and his principles.

On Reading, Writing, Learning & Self-Education

Early in his life Benjamin Franklin was interested in Books and everything related to them like reading them, writing by oneself…
